author: Lesley Waters
method: For the croissants, melt the butter in a frying pan, then place the croissants into the pan to fry for 3-4 minutes on each side, or until golden-brown. For the butterscotch apples, place the butter and sugar into a small frying pan to melt over a medium heat.  Add the chopped apple and the orange juice to the pan and cook for 5-6 minutes, then add the sultanas and cook for another minute. Finally add the cream to the pan, cover with a lid and simmer for 5-6 minutes. To serve, place the croissants onto a plate along with the butterscotch apples and a scoop of vanilla ice cream, if desired.
ingredients: 25g/1oz butter, melted,  2 plain ready-made croissants, split open lengthways,  25g/1oz butter ,  1 tbsp soft brown sugar,  1 apple, cored, chopped,  ½ orange, juice only,  1 tbsp sultanas,  75ml/2½fl oz double cream ,  ready-made vanilla ice cream, to serve, if desired
